description.en: In a vertical village, your choice of bed is a choice of perspective. It is the difference between the salt-spray of the harbor and the silence of the vineyards.

body.title:
Where to
Wake Up
body.subtitle: In a vertical village, your choice of bed is a choice of perspective. It is the difference between the salt-spray of the harbor and the silence of the vineyards.

body.quote: Riomaggiore does not have hotels in the way the world usually understands them. There are no grand lobbies, no sprawling resorts, and very few elevators.
content: Instead, the village offers **layered living**. Houses are stacked one upon another, carved into the very rock of the cliff. To stay here is to enter a family's history.
You must understand that **views come with a price**, and that price is usually measured in stairs. The higher you climb, the more dramatic the panorama.
Comfort here is **shaped by location**. In the summer, the harbor is a theater of light and sound that never truly sleeps.
To choose well is to **match your spirit to the terrain**. Are you here for the morning coffee on a balcony overlooking the boats?

items.name: Scorci Di Mare
items.intro: A 14th-century building that sits so close to the harbor you can hear the boats breathing.
items.description: Scorci Di Mare is for those who want to be at the center of the village's maritime heart. The rooms are carved into the ancient stone, offering a cool, quiet refuge from the sun.
items.giuliaComment: I always tell people that if you stay here, you should wake up early. Watch the fishermen prepare their boats before the first train arrives.
items.signature: The pulse of the marina, felt through ancient stone walls
items.practicalInfo: Located right at the harbor. Expect some noise during the day.

items.name: The Sunset Line
items.intro: High above the village, where the horizon is the only neighbor.
items.description: The Sunset Line is defined by perspective. It trades the bustle of the main street for a panoramic view that stretches across the Ligurian Sea.
items.giuliaComment: This is where I would stay if I wanted to disappear for a few days. The terraces are incredible—you feel like you're floating between the sky and the sea.
items.signature: A quiet sanctuary where the sea meets the sky
items.practicalInfo: Upper village location. Accessible via the public lift or a steep walk.

items.name: Locanda Ca Da Iride
items.intro: A garden retreat that feels like a private home tucked into the hillside.
items.description: Ca Da Iride offers a different kind of Riomaggiore experience—one centered around greenery and quiet.
items.giuliaComment: I love the garden here. In a village made of stone, having a patch of green is a luxury.
items.signature: A hidden garden where the village's verticality softens
items.practicalInfo: 10-minute walk from the harbor. Very quiet at night.

items.name: Alla Marina
items.intro: Modern comfort inside a 13th-century shell, right where the sea meets the street.
items.description: Alla Marina manages to be both historic and contemporary. The building is one of the oldest in the village, but the interiors are bright and thoughtfully designed.
items.giuliaComment: The staff here are what make the difference. They treat you like a guest in their own home.
items.signature: Where history and modern hospitality meet at the water's edge
items.practicalInfo: Harbor-side location. Excellent soundproofing despite the central location.

interludes.title: The Vertical Trade-off
interludes.quote: In Riomaggiore, every ten steps upward buys you another hour of silence. The harbor is the village's heart, but the upper streets are its soul.

body.title: The Memory of the Morning
content: In the end, what you remember of Riomaggiore is not the square footage of your room or the thread count of your sheets.
It is the way the light first touches the church tower across the valley. It is the sound of a neighbor's shutters opening.
Choose the place that matches the morning you want to have. The rest of the village will wait for you.
